meanings.definition: To seek favor by flattery or servile behavior.
meanings.sent1: He bootlicked the boss to get a promotion.
meanings.sent2: She always bootlicked her way to the top.
meanings.sent3: The cat bootlicked the dog for a treat.
meanings.sent4: The student bootlicked the teacher for a good grade.
meanings.sent5: The politician bootlicked the voters for their support.

meanings.definition: A person who seeks favor by flattery or servile behavior.
meanings.sent1: The bootlicked was always praised by the boss.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the office bootlicked.
meanings.sent3: The bootlicked made everyone laugh with their jokes.
meanings.sent4: He was the bootlicked of the group, always following others.
meanings.sent5: The bootlicked's actions were always predictable.
